>  > Looking through org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.java code, it looks like
>  > the HTTP response *should* be displayed by arcreader, but for some
>  > reason it always displays a dash (-). I'm using the most recent version
>  > of ARCReader.java (1.67). Am I doing something wrong?
>  >
> 
> I wonder if the problem is our not parsing HTTP headers when we're
> dumping 'CDX' records. See:
> http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.html#576. 
> <http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/io/arc/ARCReader.html#576.>
> St.Ack

Ahh... I'll set that to true.  It would be nice if this were a parameter 
that could be passed in at the command line:

% arcreader --parse-headers my.arc

That way when the user sees the CDX heading

CDX b e a m s c V n g

they can expect to see an HTTP response code for 's' instead of a dash.

Frank
